intro: Hieracium salebrosum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, marshes, and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are bright yellow and arranged in a cluster. Hieracium salebrosum is known for its ability to thrive in wet environments and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
